newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam says China oil talks find no common ground.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam says China oil talks find no common ground.

text.p: Vietnam said on Friday that no common ground had been found in talks with China over competing claims to an offshore area where China positioned an oil rig last month.
A foreign ministry spokesman said the Kan Tan 111 rig had now been moved out of Vietnamese territorial waters, but called on China not to allow a repetition of the incident.

"As a result of the negotiations the two sides have a better understanding of each other's point of view. However, regrettably no common perception of this issue was reached," a separate foreign ministry statement said.

"We hope that a similar incident will not be repeated in future, which might make the situation more complicated and cause impact on relations between the two countries and stability in the region," the ministry said.

China and Vietnam on Friday wrapped up three days of talks in Beijing aimed at resolving the dispute which erupted last month after the Kan Tan 111 rig was positioned in waters between central Vietnam and Hainan island.
China's foreign ministry made no comment on the outcome of the talks but said the two sides had exchanged views "in a friendly and frank atmosphere."
